sentences.english: His extreme practices aroused the alarm and horror of European bloodletting physicians .
sentences.chinese: 他的极端行为激起了欧洲放血医师的警觉和恐慌。

sentences.english: “You can only be hyper-vigilant for so long ” the special-operations officer said.
sentences.chinese: “你只能在一定时间内保持警觉，”特战官员说。

sentences.english: Her left elbow was wrapped in gauze, but she otherwise appeared alert.
sentences.chinese: 她左臂用纱布裹着，但是她还是很警觉的。

sentences.english: We must waken the people to the dangers facing our country.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当使人民警觉到国家面临的危险。

sentences.english: I hear thee trumpeter , listening alert I catch thy notes.
sentences.chinese: 我听到你，号手，我警觉地倾听着你的声音。

sentences.english: Probably because sleepy workers were less alert.
sentences.chinese: 也许是因为瞌睡的工人更缺少警觉。

sentences.english: He seemed to be unaware of the trouble he was causing.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎还没有警觉到到自己惹起的麻烦。

sentences.english: Old Jolyon was on the alert at once.
sentences.chinese: 老乔里恩立刻警觉起来。

sentences.english: The government in Beijing, which controls the banks, is alert to such criticism.
sentences.chinese: 控制这些银行的北京政府对此类批评相当警觉。

sentences.english: He has an angry wrenlike vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 他具有发怒鹪鹩般的警觉。

sentences.english: A good hunting dog is alert to every sound and movement around.
sentences.chinese: 一只好猎犬对四周任何响动均甚警觉。

sentences.english: The word diligence implies care, watchfulness, observation and a deep sense of freedom.
sentences.chinese: 勤奋这个词意味着关怀，警觉，观察和深深的自由感。

sentences.english: It may serve you, however, to be aware of consequences.
sentences.chinese: 因果报应会使你对做事的后果有所警觉。

sentences.english: "One of mine?" the simulagent asked, alarmed.
sentences.chinese: “还有个我的人？”替身警觉地问着。

sentences.english: And Sosuke found himself staring owlishly around a room that he no longer recognized.
sentences.chinese: 宗介发现自己正警觉地凝视着一个他不再熟悉的房间。

definition: to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
(of a turn of events) not too encouraging/far from good/anything but reassuring
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
